author: randomishwalk
content: Interesting throughput and latency benchmarking done here by a group of academics: https://6788543.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/6788543/Eurosys23-Diablo.pdf?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email

author: chfast
content: This issue is confirmed. We have not noticed because you are not suppose to validate already deployed EOF code. The test has to be fixed. https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/847#discussion_r1012107027

author: jochembrouwer
content: <@403636673914863626> just realized that we do re-verify deployed code each time, we should not do that right?

author: chfast
content: That's one of the EOF goal: verify once at deploy time (i.e. all deployed code is valid). But it is worth validating also code coming from tests (e.g. in JSON loader). I'd also consider validating the code when loading from disk.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yeah I thought so, upon realizing we keep validating it each time ðŸ˜…
